items.title: The Office of Student Affairs and UPV Teaching and Learning Resource Center
items.content: The Office of Student Affairs (OSA) and TLRC (UPV Teaching and Learning Resource Center Website) provides necessary student support services like summer bridge, tutorials, photocopying, printing, audio-visual room use, and borrowing of books, movies, computers, and game pieces.

items.title: UPV Guidance and Counseling Services Unit
items.content: The guidance counselor is another support service for students that offers counseling in various issues both academic and non-academic.

items.title: UPV Software Subscriptions
items.content: UP students and faculty with UP email are also eligible for access to UP software subscriptions such as ArcGIS for imagery and remote sensing data, adobe acrobat as a pdf collaborative tool, nvivo, SPSS for data analysis, qualtrics, slido, matlab, and zoom.

items.title: UP Visayas University Library
items.content: The UP Visayas University Library allows free and digital access to articles, books, online journals, electronic book collections, and research databases via institutional access (see Electronic Resources).The library maintains subscriptions to databases that are needed for the curriculum.

items.title: Computerized Registration and Student Information System
items.content: UPV CRSIS is a student information system that allows students to register and enroll online, providing a convenient and efficient way to manage their academic affairs. Faculty and staff can also access student information through the system, making it easier to track progress and offer support.

items.title: UPV Learning Management System III
items.content: LMS is a moodle-based virtual learning environment that provides a range of features and tools to support online learning, including the ability to upload and share resources, facilitate discussions and collaboration, and track student progress.
